intro: Acidocroton, commonly known as the croton, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often colorful leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Acidocroton species are typically shrubs or small trees, native to tropical and subtropical regions. They have a rough, waxy texture on their leaves and often display a wide range of leaf shapes and colors. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
